intro.description: There are several ways to access your data.

item.title: Using File > Open File
item.description: The simplest and unstructured way to access your data is to use the File > Open File... menu item. This opens the file selected in the "Open File" dialogue box in the editor area which lies right of the leftmost pane.

item.title: Project Explorer
item.description: Other ways to access your data are contained in the two tabs in the leftmost pane: Project Explorer and File Navigator. The former allows you to create projects using File > New > Project... menu, selecting Data > Data Project and then filling the dialogue to create a project with a title and a folder that links to the given directory. Try doing this with, for example, /dls/sci-scratch/ExampleData. Note that no files are copied into that project. Also a right-button click in the explorer will allow access to the New menu item too.

item.title: File Navigator
item.description: The file navigator allows you to browse your computer's file system and navigate to the files of interest.

item.title: Access Your Data
item.description: In both tabs, single (left-button) mouse clicks select a file. Any metadata held in the file contents and supported by SDA will be display in the metadata view pane situated in the bottom right-hand corner. Double clicking on a file will open that file in the editor area.
